item.title: Spanner: Google's Globally Distributed Database
item.description: Corbett, James C., et al. “Spanner: Googleâ€™s globally distributed database.” ACM Transactions on Computer Systems (TOCS) 31.3 (2013): 1-22. Spanner is a globally distributed databases, schematized semi-relational database. Data is replicated across datacenters and regions. The data is automatically sharded and distributed. Server Organization A spanner deployment is called a universe. Given it manages data globally, there are handful of universes deployed. Universe is divided into zones. Zones can be added or removed and serve as an administrative deployment (a physical isolation).
